feature_spans: To comply with the Utah Social Media Regulation Act, we are implementing a curfew-based login restriction for users under 18. The system uses ASL (Age-sensitive logic) to detect minor accounts and routes enforcement through GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) to apply only within Utah boundaries. The feature activates during restricted night hours and logs activity using EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) for auditability. This allows parental control to be enacted without user-facing alerts, operating in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) during initial rollout.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_name: Curfew login blocker with ASL and GH for Utah minors

feature_spans: As part of compliance with California’s SB976, the app will disable PF (Personalized feed) by default for users under 18 located in California. This default setting is considered NR (Not recommended (content/user status)) to override, unless explicit parental opt-in is provided. Geo-detection is handled via GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region), and rollout is monitored with FR (Feature rollout status) logs. The design ensures minimal disruption while meeting the strict personalization requirements imposed by the law.

feature_name: PF default toggle with NR enforcement for California teens

feature_spans: In line with the US federal law requiring providers to report child sexual abuse content to NCMEC, this feature scans uploads and flags suspected materials tagged as T5 (Tier 5 sensitivity data; highly sensitive per internal taxonomy). Once flagged, the CDS (Compliance Detection System) auto-generates reports and routes them via secure channel APIs. The logic runs in real-time, supports human validation, and logs detection metadata for internal audits. Regional thresholds are governed by LCP (Local compliance policy) parameters in the backend.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_name: Child abuse content scanner using T5 and CDS triggers

feature_spans: To meet the transparency expectations of the EU Digital Services Act, we are introducing a visibility lock for flagged user-generated content labeled under NSP (Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally)). When such content is detected, a soft Softblock (User-level limitation applied silently without notifications) is applied and GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) ensures enforcement is restricted to the EU region only. EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) supports traceability, and Redline (Flag for legal review) status can be triggered for legal review. This feature enhances accountability and complies with Article 16’s removal mechanisms.

feature_name: Content visibility lock with NSP for EU DSA

feature_spans: To support Florida's Online Protections for Minors law, this feature extends the Jellybean (Internal parental control system) parental control framework. Notifications are dispatched to verified parent accounts when a minor attempts to access restricted features. Using IMT (Internal monitoring trigger), the system checks behavioral anomalies against BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) models. If violations are detected, restrictions are applied in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) with full audit logging through CDS (Compliance Detection System). Glow (Compliance flagging status used for geo-based alerts) flags ensure compliance visibility during rollout phases.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_name: Jellybean-based parental notifications for Florida regulation

feature_spans: Introduce a data retention feature using DRT (Data retention threshold; duration for which logs can be stored) thresholds, ensuring automatic log deletion across all regions. CDS (Compliance Detection System) will continuously audit retention violations, triggering EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) as necessary. Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) logic ensures all platform modules comply uniformly.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_name: Unified retention control via DRT & CDS

feature_spans: This feature will automatically detect and tag content that violates NSP (Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally)) policy. Once flagged, Softblock (User-level limitation applied silently without notifications) is applied and a Redline (Flag for legal review) alert is generated if downstream sharing is attempted.

feature_name: NSP auto-flagging

feature_spans: When users report content containing high-risk information, it is tagged as T5 (Tier 5 sensitivity data; highly sensitive per internal taxonomy) for internal routing. CDS (Compliance Detection System) then enforces escalation. The system is universal and does not rely on regional toggles or GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) routes.

feature_name: T5 tagging for sensitive reports

feature_spans: Snowcap (Child-safety policy framework) is activated for all underage users platform-wide, applying ASL (Age-sensitive logic) to segment accounts. Actions taken under this logic are routed to CDS (Compliance Detection System) and monitored using BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) to identify deviations in usage.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_name: Underage protection via Snowcap trigger

feature_spans: By default, PF (Personalized feed) will be turned off for all uses browsing in guest mode.

feature_name: Universal PF deactivation on guest mode

feature_spans: Enable users to reshare stories from others, with auto-expiry after 48 hours. This feature logs resharing attempts with EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) and stores activity under BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection).

feature_name: Story resharing with content expiry

feature_spans: Introduce a creator leaderboard updated weekly using internal analytics. Points and rankings are stored in FR (Feature rollout status) metadata and tracked using IMT (Internal monitoring trigger).

feature_name: Leaderboard system for weekly creators

feature_spans: Adjust PF (Personalized feed) recommendations based on inferred mood signals from emoji usage. This logic is soft-tuned using BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) and undergoes quiet testing in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only).

feature_name: Mood-based PF enhancements

feature_spans: At onboarding, users will receive NR (Not recommended (content/user status))-curated profiles to follow for faster network building. A/B testing will use Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine).

feature_name: New user rewards via NR profile suggestions

feature_spans: Monetization events will be tracked through CDS (Compliance Detection System) to detect anomalies in creator payouts. DRT (Data retention threshold; duration for which logs can be stored) rules apply for log trimming.

feature_name: Creator fund payout tracking in CDS

feature_spans: Roll out video reply functionality to users in EEA only. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) will manage exposure control, and BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) is used to baseline feedback.

feature_name: Trial run of video replies in EU

feature_spans: Launch a PF (Personalized feed) variant in CA as part of early experimentation. Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) will isolate affected cohorts and Glow (Compliance flagging status used for geo-based alerts) flags will monitor feature health.

feature_name: Canada-first PF variant test

feature_spans: A new chat layout will be tested in the following regions: CA, US, BR, ID. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) will ensure location targeting and ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) will collect usage metrics without user impact.

feature_name: Chat UI overhaul

feature_spans: Enable video autoplay only for users in US. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) filters users, while Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) logs click-through deltas.

feature_name: Regional trial of autoplay behavior

feature_spans: A/B test dark theme accessibility for users in South Korea. Rollout is limited via GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) and monitored with FR (Feature rollout status) flags.

feature_name: South Korea dark theme A/B experiment

feature_spans: Notifications will be tailored by age using ASL (Age-sensitive logic), allowing us to throttle or suppress push alerts for minors. EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) will log adjustments, and CDS (Compliance Detection System) will verify enforcement across rollout waves.

feature_spans: Introduce limits on video uploads from new accounts. IMT (Internal monitoring trigger) will trigger thresholds based on BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) patterns. These limitations are partly for platform safety but without direct legal mapping.

feature_name: Video upload limits for new users

feature_spans: A flow that detects high-risk comment content and routes it via CDS (Compliance Detection System) with Redline (Flag for legal review) markers. The logic applies generally and is monitored through EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification), with no mention of regional policies.

feature_name: Flag escalation flow for sensitive comments

feature_spans: Behavioral scoring via Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) will be used to gate access to certain tools. The feature tracks usage and adjusts gating based on BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) divergence.

feature_name: User behavior scoring for policy gating

feature_spans: We’re expanding chat features, but for users flagged by Jellybean (Internal parental control system), certain functions (e.g., media sharing) will be limited. BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) and ASL (Age-sensitive logic) will monitor compliance posture.
